page.title: 05Local History Eagle Hall
page.content: Eagle Hall is one mile south west of Eagle village.It comprises of one thousand acres of land including one hundred and thirty acres of woods and plantations.The old hall,with a great part of the land,once belonged to Henry Nevile,Esq.Adjoining it is another estate called Eagle Woodhouse.Both of these were the property of a commandery of Knights Templar founded by King Stephen and afterwards given to the Knights Hospitallers of St.John of Jerusalem, but dissolved in 1541.The monastery stood near Eagle Hall where its sight is still distinguishable by the remains of large banks and ditches. There was once a moat round Eagle Hall and there are stories of secret passages leading from the hall to Eagle church.Today both Eagle Hall and Eagle Woodhouse are farmed.
